sense.gloss: tug of war (orig. a form of divination to predict whether the year will be favourable or unfavourable)

sdata.j: ↑国会↑↓こっかい↓の↑動↑↓うご↓きはこの↑問題↑↓もんだい↓をめぐる↑与野党↑↓よやとう↓↑間↑↓かん↓の↑政治↑↓せいじ↓↑的↑↓てき↓↑綱引↑↓|つなひ↓き|となった。
sdata.e: Parliamentary activity has become a political tug of war between the ruling and opposition parties over the issue.

sdata.j: 「↑委員↑↓いいん↓↑長↑↓ちょう↓、↑後↑↓ご↓は↑何↑↓なに↓を↑運↑↓はこ↓ぶんだっけ？」「↑得点板↑↓とくてんばん↓と↑大玉↑↓おおだま↓もう↑一↑↓いち↓↑個↑↓こ↓、↑綱引↑↓|つなひ↓き|の↑綱↑↓つな↓」
sdata.e: Mr Chairman, what needs moving next, again? "Scoreboard, giant ball and the tug-of-war rope."
